turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: When do these hot-headed boys of yours go on the road?

turns.speaker: D'ANGELO
turns.text: Coupla weeks.  For eight weeks.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: That's a nice tour.  All booked?  When was Susie around here last?

turns.speaker: D'ANGELO
turns.text: Four five nights ago.  That's how I know the romance is off.  Also Steve's in a very bad mood.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Listen, Frank, you'd better make sure you're telling me the truth.

turns.speaker: D'ANGELO
turns.text: I don't like this threatening attitude.  When it comes to it, what the heck is it your business what they do, this boy and girl...

turns.speaker: D'ANGELO
turns.text: ...People catch on quick to such an item.  Van Cleve already called me - he's firing the quintet.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Then what are you doing here?  Go over there and fight!  If Van Cleve fires your boy, it gives a lie the ring of truth!

turns.speaker: ELWELL
turns.text: I see Bartha gave you cold tongue for supper.  Hey, wait a minute!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I'm late for a date with a dame.

turns.speaker: ELWELL
turns.text: How is dear old J.J. by the way?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Call him up and ask - he might drop dead with shock.

turns.speaker: ELWELL
turns.text: If it were that easy, you wouldn't find an empty phone booth for the next two hours...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You don't know that lunatic yet? Whims - egotistic whims!  Like the gag - when you got him for a friend, you don't need an enemy!  That's what the fight with Bartha was about. "Leo", I says, "Hunsecker froze me out.  So I'm eating humble pie this month - please print me an item."

turns.speaker: ELWELL
turns.text: And, instead, he printed his heel in your face?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I see you're full of human feelings...

turns.speaker: ELWELL
turns.text: Friends call me Otis - sometimes Tricky Otis.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Otis was outraged when I told him Van Cleve was going to fire you. Tell him not to pay any attention to anything you-know-who says about you-know-what.  Right, Otis?

turns.speaker: ELWELL
turns.text: Right!

turns.speaker: ELWELL
turns.text: I hate J.J. -- but not that much at this moment...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Give me a chance --

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Blessings on thee, the both...well... Gotta run now.  See you two kids later!

turns.speaker: ELWELL
turns.text: Hurry back.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Well, son, looks like you went out and bought yourself a packet of trouble...

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: You've been very kind about it, Mr. Hunsecker. HUNSECKER Give Susie credit for that.  I took her word that there was nothing to the smear.  Matter of fact, I'll have my say about smears on the show today.  That's why I'd like YOUR personal assurance, too.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Mr. Hunsecker, there's nothing to that smear.  You have my sincere word...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: I'll by that, son.  Now, you owe ME a favor.  Be good to my kid sister...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Take it easy, Susie.  He wouldn't be much of a man if he didn't understand my concern.  Would you, son?

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: No, I wouldn't...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Serious as a deacon...I like it.  I like your style, son!  In a world of old rags and bones, I like it! For instance, take Sidney.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Does he have to be here in our hair?

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Why, has he bothered you before?

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Is it news to you?

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Son, lots of people tell me I'm a gifted man, but I still can't see around corners.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Just exactly what are you so hot about?  I mean, I know it's a difficult thing to be an artist in this crudest of possible worlds, but --

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Nuts!  I'm not here as an artist! I'm here as an average Joe, who happens to love your sister Susie!

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Well, just be careful you don't knock her down, huh?

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Frankly, son, you lost me on that last hill.  Just give us the punch line...

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: No punch line.  Maybe I was just admiring your know-how---yours and Falco's.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Why do you keep coupling me with Falco?

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: He's here, isn't he?  Do you think, sir, when he dies he'll go to the dog and cat heaven?

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: I don't take kindly to you and Falco selling me ethics.  Who's the injured party here, you?

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Right now you're in no position to ask questions!  And your snide remarks---

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Wait a minute, I haven't handed over punishing privileges to you YET!  Put the whip down and I might respect what you're saying...

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Mr. Hunsecker, you've got more twists than a barrel of pretzels.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: You hear that, Susie...  Continue please...

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: I'm afraid I can't cope with them.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Susie, as always, is free to say anything she thinks.  Go on, dear, say exactly what's on your mind, dear.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Those "dears" sound like daggers. May I suggest that you stop DARING her to speak?

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: May I lift my eyebrows?  What is this?  What are you trying to do?

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: I'm trying to get Susie to stand up to you.  But your manner is so threatening that she's afraid to speak!

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Son, you raise your voice again and you'll be outa here on your golden pratt!

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: If looks could kill, I'm dead...

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: No, I don't care about you -- you're fantastic.  My whole interest, if it's not too late, is in Susie...and how to undo what you've done to her...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: And what have I done to her, besides not buy her a new fur coat lately?  Sidney, you were right -- the boy's a dilly.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Why?  Because I don't like the way you toy with human lives? - Your contempt and malice?  Because I won't be the accomplice of your sick ego - and the way it's crippled Susie...?  You think of yourself - you and your column - you see yourself as a national glory...but to me, and thousands of others like me, you and your slimy scandal, your phony patriotics - to me, Mr. Hunsecker, you are a national disgrace!

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Son, I don't fancy shooting mosquitoes with elephant guns.  So suppose you just shuffle along and call it a day...

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: But my day with Susie isn't over yet and--

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Ten'll get you fifty you're playing hookey from a padded cell!

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Susie, you're very much in my thoughts today.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: What a question, dear, with that newspaper in your hand...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Did Sidney tell you about it?

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Yes, he phoned.  I don't know this boy too well.  Anything in these charges?

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Not being partial, are you?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: No, I'm not.  I'm not!

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Why are you trembling, dear...?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: History repeats itself.  Everything that happened to Alan Leslie...began with a smear like this...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: It's just as if I've seen a ghost today...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: But that wasn't your fault, dear, what happened to Leslie.  I've told you that a million times...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Then whose fault was it, J.J.?  It was someone's fault, wasn't it?

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: I wouldn't have called the boy exactly balanced...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Alan was not...unbalanced when I married him.  And he was not...'indifferent to women' no matter what they said! HUNSECKER  I'm not fighting with you, puss...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Sidney is a liar!

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Who said Sidney?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I said Sidney!...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: You know, dear, we're drifting apart, you and I, and I don't like that.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I thought we were talking about Sidney?

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Let me finish, dear.  You had your say, now let me have mine...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I haven't said anything yet, J.J., but if -

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: I started to say we're drifting apart.  A year ago, in your wildest dreams, would you have walked by that door without taking up this situation with me?  Today I had to call you in!

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I'm taking up the situation with you now...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Susie, I want to help you--, there's nothing I won't do for you. You're all I've got in the whole, wide world.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: When I'm certain, I'll let you know...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: A man couldn't ask for a squarer shake.  Let me have Billy Van Cleve...  Don't ever tell anyone, Susie, how I'm tied to your apron strings...  Billy!  J.J.!  What's this about that boy?  What boy?  Where are we, lug, in a drawing room comedy? You're brain is warming up, sweetheart - yeah, Dallas!...  No, don't explain your point of view, but...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Susie likes to keep her girlish secrets.  But in her heart of hearts I imagine, Dallas, that she fancies you in an uncommon way. Now, what about YOU, son?  Not just tom-catting around...I hope?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: J.J., Steve isn't...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Susie, did you know about this accusation...?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Before you leave, son, I'll answer your question---Susan Hunsecker is the injured party here!  Or will I be hearing next that I don't even have my sister's welfare at heart...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Susie, I'm sorry if---

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Sometimes I think ALL men are fools!...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: You in a mood, Susie, to run over to Milgrim's later and buy a few new frocks?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: No.  I'm going home.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: No!  NO!  Don't touch me!

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Susan!...

turns.speaker: SENATOR
turns.text: Err...the Supreme Court story, I was telling you - Justice Black.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Yes, the Justice, that's right. But I think you had it in the column.

turns.speaker: SENATOR
turns.text: And I believe that's precisely where I read it, too.  You see, J.J., where I get my reputation for being the best-informed man in Washington.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Now don't kid a kidder.

turns.speaker: SENATOR
turns.text: Now, come, J.J., that's a little too harsh.  Anyone seems fair game for you tonight.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: This man is not for you, Harvey, and you shouldn't be seen with him in public.  Because that's another part of a press agents life - he digs up scandal among prominent men and shovels it thin among the columnists who give him space.

turns.speaker: SENATOR
turns.text: There is some allusion here that escapes me...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: We're friends, Harvey - we go as far back as when you were a fresh kid Congressman, don't we?

turns.speaker: SENATOR
turns.text: Why does everything you say sound like a threat?

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Hello, Harry.

turns.speaker: KELLO
turns.text: Bonna sera, commendatore.  Come sta?

turns.speaker: KELLO
turns.text: I just checked "downtown".  Quiet everywhere tonight.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Incidentally, what happened to that doll? - You gave me the item last night.  Still alive?

turns.speaker: KELLO
turns.text: Yeah.  At Bellevue.  Still hanging on.  But they still don't know if she was pushed.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: She mighta jumped.  Love suicide?  Check it for me, Phil...it's a real heart throb.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Say hello to Sidney Falco.  Tickle him - he's been a bad boy tonight. He called you my fat friend.

turns.speaker: KELLO
turns.text: I don't believe it.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Say, that's good - it's nice - in fact, it's APT, Harry!

turns.speaker: KELLO
turns.text: Yeah, I got eyes.  I put things together.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: I remember ONCE when you didn't quite "put things together".  Boy! Was the Mayor mad!

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Can I come out?  No.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I have to talk to you, alone, J.J., that's why.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: You had something to do for me - you didn't do it.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Can I come in for a minute?

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: No.  You're dead, son - get yourself buried!

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Mac!  I don't want this man at my table...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I have a message from your sister.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I know Manny Davis.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Everyone knows Manny Davis...  ...except MRS. Manny Davis.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Match me, Sidney...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Not just this minute, J.J....

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Why don't you answer the man, Sidalee?  He's trying to take you off the hook.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You just had a good example of it. A press agent eats a columnists dirt and is expected to call it manna.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: What, some cheap, gruesome gags?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You print them, don't you?

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Yes, with your clients' names attached.  That's the only reason those poor slobs pay you - to see their names in my column all over the world!  Now, as I make it out, you're doing ME a favor!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I didn't say that, J.J.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: The day that I can't get along without press agents' handouts, I'll close up shop, lock, stock and barrel and move to Alaska.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Spahish...that must show he likes "spigs", too.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: I like Harry, but I can't deny he sweats a little.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: You told me you'd break up that romance - when?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You want something done, J.J., but I doubt if you yourself know what's involved.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: I'm a schoolboy - teach me, teach me.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Why not break it up yourself?  You could do it in two minutes flat.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Frankly, J.J., I don't think you got the cards to blitz me.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: I don't?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Correct me if I'm wrong, but I don't think so...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: I'll listen one more minute.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Awright, that brings us up to five weeks ago. "Sidney, I got a nasty little problem here." Did I say no? I'm frank to admit - it don't jell as fast as we like... But all of a sudden I CAN'T GET YOU ON THE PHONE NO MORE!  WHY?... And why, as of this date, am I frozen out of the column...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Are you finished?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No, lemme finish.  I DON'T LIKE THIS JOB!  That boy is dumb only on matinee days - otherwise he's got a head.  And Susan, like you said, she's growing up.  Two heads. What I mean, we got a slippery, dangerous problem here!

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Not "we", Sidney, you!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Correct me if I'm wrong - WE! Because when I'm out on this very slippery limb for you, you have to know what's involved.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Ha!  My right hand hasn't seen my left hand for thirty years!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I'll do it, J.J. - don't get me wrong - in for a penny, in for a pound.  I'll see it through, but stop beating me around the head. Let me make a living!

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: What you promised - do it!  Don't finagle around.  It's later than you think.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Uh huh.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Tonight.  Before you go to bed. The cat is in the bag and the bag is in the river.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: J.J., I want you to get them back their job, Steve and the Quintet.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: You mean they've been fired already, on the basis of this crude smear?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I know Steve.  No.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Then maybe you can tell me if he's as solid as you say, why does he rap me every chance he gets?

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Well, what have I got?  Alimony to a pair of tramps?  They're of no concern to me.  It's you who count, but don't get me wrong - I don't intend to let you break your neck again!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: J.J., you said you want to help me - prove it!

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Get Steve back his job...please...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: He means that much to you...?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Yes.  With your "prestige" it only takes a minute - ten cents worth of American Tel and Tel.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: You're picking up my lingo, hon.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I read your column every day...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Susie, I like this new attitude of yours.  You're growing up and I like it!  I don't like it when you're limp and dependent, when you're odd and wayward.  This gives you a chance for real survival in a very lousy world.  Because, don't forget, dear, you won't always have me with you, will you...?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No, I won't...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I'm not sure I can reach him in time.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Sure you can if you want to, and I know you'll want to...  By the way, what's your beef against little Sidney?

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: I got that boy coming over here.  What's so funny?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: With a pocket fulla firecrackers - good.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: I think you loused this up but good. If I can trust my eyes, and I think I can, Susie knows all about your dirty work.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Can't hurt...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Can't hurt?  I had to get him back his job.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I like that, too.  Look, J.J., we can wrap this up in one neat bundle, addressed to the dumps - to oblivion.  We're going great, but please play it my way. I cased this kid. Know his ins and outs...He's fulla juice and vinegar, just begging for some big shot like you to give him a squeeze.  Do little Sidney a favor: squeeze! - You know, J.J. - the porcupine bit - needles.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: But it's too late.  I got him back the job...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No, that's the point - he won't accept your favor!  The manager yes, but not the boy.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Well he's got her in a tizzy, I'll tell you that!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Sure, he steams her up - wants her to stand on her own two feet and all that jazz!

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: And who's feet is she on now?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Presumably yours...  That's according to St. Dallas.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: What's this boy got that Susie likes?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Integrity - acute, like indigestion.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: What does that mean - integrity?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: A pocket fulla firecrackers - looking for a match!  It's a new wrinkle to tell the truth... I never thought I'd make a killing on some guy's "integrity".

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Full of beans, ain't you?  But you know that you'll stand or fall by what you're doing now...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Calculated risk.  Only we happen to know, J.J., that you like me.  I'm your star pupil -- I reflect back to you your own talent.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Let's forget cats and dogs and other pseudo-literary remarks--- I'll just lay it on the line!  What about that big rumpus in my office today?  You were there, Frank! Where, according to St. Dallas, J.J. was responsible for the Elwell smear!

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Don't go wild, Sidney.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Wild?  Take a look at them and see who's wild...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: What are you so chipper about?  If I put a cross on every one of your mistakes, you'd look like a graveyard!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: But not for anything I did today...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Sidney, I know human nature.  Susie lied to me - she'll see that boy again.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Are you listening?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: How does it matter who's sister? The main thing, they're through and -

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Why do something that would drive them right back into each other's arms?  Not to mention that this time Susie would know who shot the arrow...

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: She knows now.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Why give her real proof?  You nearly ruined her with her first husband - and you were right, J.J., - but she almost followed him out the window.  What do you want - a chronic invalid?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: J.J., it's one thing to wear your dog collar...but when it gets to be a noose...I'd rather have my freedom.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: The man in jail is always for freedom.

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Sidney, I told you -

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: J.J., I swear to you on my mother's life, I won't do it.  If you gave me your COLUMN I wouldn't do a thing like that...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I was trying to build her up, not tear her down -

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Is that why you were romancing her, you mutt!  Let's call it quits, my dear.  I'd like it fine if you found another home.  That means the front door is open!  Pack your things, rent a moving van and GIT!  And as for marriage, let me hit you with a few choice facts: you aren't ready for marriage!  You're incompetent - a capricious and shaky frail with a sick fatality for frail and useless men!

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: Talk to her, Sidney...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Talk to her yourself...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Listen with care - this will cost me everything, so you know I'm telling you the truth!

turns.speaker: HUNSECKER
turns.text: You're incapable of the truth...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Susie, there's nothing wrong with Dallas!  Your brother and I arranged it all. And if the Leslie boy is still a squooshy item in your life, forget it! - your brother arranged that one, too!  I don't usually give away presents; but this is my gift to you: Get out of here!  Leave this man!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I know...I know you're the strongest cop in town.

turns.speaker: KELLO
turns.text: I call him the boy with the ice cream face!

turns.speaker: KELLO
turns.text: What's all the rush?  You said three o'clock.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: He's leaving early.  After this "set".  He'll be out in a couple of minutes...

turns.speaker: KELLO
turns.text: It's nice, Sidney, that you give me this tip...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: - He's got them on him.

turns.speaker: KELLO
turns.text: ...And he's got them on him.  I appreciate a thing like that - I appreciate where you are looking out for the virtue of the city.

turns.speaker: KELLO
turns.text: Is that a fact?  He's a dilly, ain't he?  By the by, what did he have against this boy?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: He goes out with girls.

turns.speaker: KELLO
turns.text: Well, I'll be darned.  And what does J.J. think he SHOULD do?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Go out with DIFFERENT girls!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I thought he would.

turns.speaker: KELLO
turns.text: Yeah...  And another thing - he's gonna say you 'resisted arrest'...  You know J.J....!

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: That's a question I usually like to ask YOU.  Your secretary phoned.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What about?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Something about a Frank D'Angelo trying to reach you...

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Could this be that boy?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Dallas?  Could be.  He doesn't look like a reefer smoker...

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Bribing me again?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: And why should I bribe the woman who holds most of my heart?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Who put this item in about the comic?  "If there's a more hilarious funny man around than Herbie Temple at the Palace, you'll have to pardon us for not catching the name.  We were too busy screaming." Does this Temple have a press agent?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: No.  It's one of J.J.'s occasional beau gestes.  Evidently the fellow's funny, so he gave him a plug.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What's your favorite ribbon to go around your favorite chocolates?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Let's wait till Christmas - it's more legitimate then.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Don't you ever get messages, Eyelashes?  I called you twice.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I've been up to here.  Listen, honey, tell me something.  You know Susan Hunsecker...?  Has she been in?  I mean lately, in the last coupla days...?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You're sure.  Find out for me.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Sidney, can I talk to you a minute?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Is Frank D'Angelo around?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: At the bar - Sidney...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Don't tell me you started a polka with Leo Bartha?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: No.  That's what I mean - I'm being fired for what I didn't do.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Avidly.  He was staring.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Staring.  Consequently, when he approached me on his way out I wasn't surprised, but I didn't let on.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: He was writing a special Sunday piece on...?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: ...cigarette girls... And naturally -

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You were thrilled to be interviewed.  Were you "interviewed"?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: In his apartment -

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: And where was his wife?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: I don't know - it's a big apartment. But I wasn't interviewed.  In fact, I was totally unprepared for what happened.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: We're old friends, Chickie - quit it!  A big columnist comes in this room, without his ball-and-chain and you make like a delicatessen counter!  What did you think would happen in his house?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: But, Sidney darling, the man must be out of his mind - it was only eleven o'clock in the morning!

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Do you think you could do something, Sidney?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: That's what I'm thinking, Rita. Maybe...

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Do you still keep your key under the mat?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Can you be there by two-thirty?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Rita, say hello to Otis Elwell.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Back?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: One of those business meetings, honey - always coming up in the middle of the night.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Don't you know who that man is?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Yeah.  Otis Elwell.  The columnist.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Yeah!

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: And he's a perfect stranger to me.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: So take five minutes!  Get acquainted!  He's an important man - he's lonely - don't be dumb!

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: What do you want all of a sudden - Lady Godiva...?  Where's my other shoe?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What kind of an act is this?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Don't you think I have any feelings? What am I?  A bowl of fruit?  A tangerine that peels in a minute?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I beg your pardon!  I turn myself inside out to help you and now I'm a heavy.  Here's your shoe, there's your coat, that's the door!

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Sidney...I...I don't do this sort of thing...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What sort of thing?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: This sort of thing!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Listen, you need him for a favor, don't you!  And so do I!  I need his column--tonight.  Didn't you ask me to do something about your job?  Don't you have a kid in Military School?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: A girl needs a little romancing before she -

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Next time I'll call in a guy to paint silver stars on the ceiling!

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: What would you think of me if -

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Nothing I didn't think of you before.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: - that's what I mean!

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: That's the third time he's called today.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: He wants me to break a leg?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: No, an arm, he said.  I told him you were sure the item would be in Mr. Hunsecker's column in tomorrow's...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: It isn't.  I've just seen the early edition.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: But...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: But what?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: That makes five days in a row that Mr. Hunsecker's cut you out of his column.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: May I rent you out as an adding machine.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Who else phoned?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: The renting agent and the tailor.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Pay the rent.  Let the tailor wait.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: It won't leave much of a balance in the bank...  Mr. Robard?  Could you locate him?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I wish I could help in some way, Sidney.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Help me with two minutes of silence!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Go home, Sally.  It's late...

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I hate to see you like this --

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Yes, but as a new subscriber you're under no obligation to take more than three books.  And if you mail the enclosed card within ten days --

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Sidney, I know you by now.  Don't do a dance with me...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You mean you don't want the extra free gift of a colorful giant map of the world???

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Sidney, please, dear, if you feel nervous...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: So what'll you do if I feel nervous? You'll open your meaty, sympathetic arms...?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Sid...you got me so...I don't know what...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You ought to be used to me by now.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I'm used to you...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No.  You think I'm a hero.  I'm no hero.  I'm nice to people where it pays me to be.  I gotta do it too much on the outside, so don't expect me to kow-tow in my own office.  I'm in a bind right now with Hunsecker so --  Every dog has his day!  Lock up and leave the key.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: If that's for me, tear it up!

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Take a top coat.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: And leave a tip in every hat-check room in town?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Nothing...
